docs.text: at story's start , president bush has declared a ceasefire , and american troops are tying up loose ends .

docs.text: gates leaves his jurisdiction to commandeer the situation ; he proposes-demands-that barlow , elgin , and vig join him on a treasure hunt .

docs.text: so is finding the treasure , until the four men realize the magnitude of discord still breathing in iraq : saddam's men are threatening the dictator's detractors ( citizens of his own country ) with violence .

docs.text: but the money hungry gates has a conscience , and when one female bystander is shot by a sadistic grunt before these americans have left the scene , he orders barlow , elgin and vig to open fire on the surrounding arab forces .

docs.text: russell has shocked us before : his first film , spanking the monkey , is about a young man's affair with his bedridden mother .

docs.text: one could argue that it's easier to make an audience react to such sexual deviance than explosions , though ; russell disturbs us in three kings by being no-nonsense about the violence .
